Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2011 11:15PM grandmarose wrote: jackifp, Like you, I'm keeping my hair the color it grew back with.  Kinda a silver, grey, black.  Very soft and curly, but with the growth that I've gotten in the year plus since my last chemo, its more of a ringlet.   My hair before TX was brillo pad curly and unmanagable and not at all soft.  That's one reason why I'm not tempting fate by doing anything that might upset the apple cart and bring back my old hair.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 01:14AM grandmarose wrote: jackifp, It took about six to eight months for it to start to show curl I think.  I don't honestly remeber, but it was when my hair was about two inches long.  Now its just touches my shoulders and its been growing out since the end of May 2010.

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2011 06:27PM grandmarose wrote: Ok, so this whats been going on since my surgery on 10/12.  Spent the night in the hospital post surgery, got my post-sugery appt. for the 20th.  My right leg was bothering me with what felt like a vise grip was attached. At my appt. my BS ordered a ultra-sound and I was diagnosed with thromboses in my right calf.  So I was put on warfrin to thin my blood. By the following Fri.-the 28th I had a large blood clot by my knee, about the size of a sausage link on the inside side of my right knee-cap.  I wound up in the hospital for a week, being on 2 anti-biotics and two blood thinners.  Home now and doing much better.  My question to the heavens is what are you going to throw at me next. LOL

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2011 05:32PM grandmarose wrote: To all of you facing surgery this first week and through out the month of Oct, May gods touch be on each and every one of you and may you all have a speedy recovery.  I wish I could go back to the happiest place and time for me, Ocean Shores in WA state, running on the beach and useing my big toe to circle the spot wear a razor clam was for my dad, God bless his soul. I always think of him every time I'm at the ocean and no  matter what time of year it is I have to get in the water up to my knees and look up and say hi to my dad.

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2011 05:59PM grandmarose wrote: Hi Frustrated, I too had a second mastectomy with no cancer involvement on the 12th of Oct. Due to the type of cancer cells I had and the high risk of recurrence I decided to go ahead and do the surgery.  I had my first surgery in Dec. 2009 and had several conversations with my surgeon before deciding to have the surgery. My back and neck pain has decreased too. I don't know if that was an issue for you or not but my surgery helped me.   Good luck with your up coming surgery and a speedy recovery.
Posts.Title: Surgery Date Frustrated_Canadian Frustrated_Canadian

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2011 06:35AM grandmarose wrote: Maria,  My surgery was also suppose to be on 5ht but when I went in for my pre-surgery appointment his nurse told me they had to switch it to the 12th.  That's when the days start to crawl very slowly.  The last couple of months have flown by and this one is moving at a snails pace. After surgery I have my BF birthday on the 19th, a friends BD on the same date, my post-surgery appt. on the 20th and my Granddaughter BD party on the 22nd.  At that point I think the time will be flying lol.  Best wishes to all who are having surgery between now and the weekend.  Have a speedy recovery with no complications.
